abstract: Amer group hastens to offer reward for Hitler's capture on information that he is going to drive through front even at cost of 500,000 German lives
snippet: A reward of $1,000,000 in cash to the person or group who will deliver Adolf Hitler "alive, unwounded and unhurt" into the custody of the League of Nations was offered yesterday in behalf of a group of Pittsburgh residents by Samuel Harden Church,...

headline.main: $1,000,000 for Capture of Hitler 'Alive and Unhurt' Is Offered Here; Pittsburgh Group Headed by S. H. Church Would Try Nazi Fuehrer Before a World Court for 'Crimes Against Peace'

lead_paragraph: A reward of $1,000,000 in cash to the person or group who will deliver Adolf Hitler "alive, unwounded and unhurt" into the custody of the League of Nations was offered yesterday in behalf of a group of Pittsburgh residents by Samuel Harden Church, president of the Carnegie Institute.
